result.execSummary:
The defendant Dylan D Sparks was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Violate/Harassment Restraining Order [Modifiers: Repeater], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 813.125(7).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: The Court sentences Mr. Sparks to pay a fine of $200 + costs = $505, plus $200 DNA surcharge= $705, to be paid in $100 per month installments commencing on 5/28/15 and on the 28th day of each month thereafter until paid in full. Non-payment shall result in a 14 day jail term, with Huber privileges consecutive to any sentence in being.  This alternate jail term can be served in Jefferson County, or it may be served in another county as long as it is at no additional cost to Jefferson County taxpayers and conditional on there being no use of electronic monitoring for service of the jail term.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Dylan D Sparks

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: With elements and criminal case settlement agreement forms attached.

[MK] case called at 2:35pm. 
Defendant Dylan D Sparks in court with Attorney John H. Bradley.  ADA Theresa Beck appears for the State of Wisconsin.  
Constitutional rights reviewed; plea of " Guilty " entered; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; the Court accepts plea, finds Mr. Sparks guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

The Court sentences Mr. Sparks to pay a fine of $200 + costs = $505, plus $200 DNA surcharge= $705, to be paid in $100 per month installments commencing on 5/28/15 and on the 28th day of each month thereafter until paid in full. Non-payment shall result in a 14 day jail term, with Huber privileges consecutive to any sentence in being.  This alternate jail term can be served in Jefferson County, or it may be served in another county as long as it is at no additional cost to Jefferson County taxpayers and conditional on there being no use of electronic monitoring for service of the jail term. 
The Court denies the request of the Defense to waive the DNA surcharge payment-requirement. 
recess 2:55pm.
Sentencing hearing on April 28, 2015 at 02:30 pm.

Case called at 1:01 [mo]
Defendant Dylan D Sparks in court with Attorney John H. Bradley.   ADA Theresa Beck appears for the State of Wisconsin.
[This case was scheduled for Plea and Sentencing today]
Attorney Bradley indicates that new Information was filed very recently and he would like additional time to go over it with both Mr. Sparks and the assigned prosecutor as it could have an impact on the resolution of this case. 
ADA Beck confirms victim rights compliance.
ADA Beck does not object to adjourning the Plea and Sentencing hearing. 
The Court and Counsel discuss scheduling
recess:1:06pm

NEXT: ADJOURNED PLEA & SENT: APRIL 28,2015 AT 2:30PM
Plea/sentencing hearing on April 13, 2015 at 01:00 pm.
Letter from Attorney Bradley requesting case be scheduled for plea/sent hearing
Jury trial on April 23, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Final status/scheduling conference on April 20, 2015 at 01:00 pm.
Pre-trial conference on March 4, 2015 at 09:20 am.

case called at 3:50pm. [MK]
Attorney John H. Bradley in court.  ADA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin. 
Attorney Bradley files an Authorization.
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived.
The Court finds probable cause to exist within the Criminal Complaint.  
Plea of "not guilty" entered; speedy trial waived by the Defense.


The Court requires $1,500 signature bond, with conditions: 
--no contact with Amy Lauersdorf
--no acts or threats of violence
--to report to the Jefferson County Sheriff's Department for booking by 4:00pm on 2/20/15
--Mr. Sparks is to report to the Clerk of Courts Office by 4:00pm on 2/20/15 to sign this Bond. 
recess 3:57pm 


NEXT:  (1) Pretrial Conference on 3/4/15 at 9:20am  (2)  FSSC on 4/20/15 at 1:00pm. (3) Jury Trial on 4/23-4/24/15 at 8:30am.
